job_description: Business Process Analyst - job post Purple Drive Technologies 4 reviews Bellevue, WA 98006 $60 - $70 an hour -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $60 - $70 an hour Job Type Full-time Role & Responsibility: Identifying areas of improvement by analysing existing business processes to identify areas of inefficiency and determine where improvements can be made. Collecting data on key performance metrics, such as process cycle time, process cost, and process quality, to measure the effectiveness of existing processes. Designing new processes that are more efficient, effective, and aligned with organizational goals and objectives. Creating and maintaining process documentation, including process maps, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and training materials. Working with cross-functional teams to implement process improvement initiatives and ensure successful adoption of new processes. Conducting training sessions for employees on new processes and procedures. Monitoring process performance and conducting regular audits to ensure compliance with established standards and identify areas for further improvement. Communicating with stakeholders, including senior leaders, department heads, and front-line employees, to gather feedback, share progress updates, and ensure alignment with organizational goals and objectives. Skills: Bachelor's degree in business administration, management, or a related field. Experience with process improvement methodologies such as Lean Six Sigma, Kaizen, or Agile. Experience with Power BI Experience with change management is a plus. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in process mapping and documentation tools, such as Visio, Ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team. Experience with project management and change management. Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Ability to commute/relocate: Bellevue, WA 98006: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: One location Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Clinical Trial Business Analyst - job post Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center 333 reviews Seattle, WA 98109 • Hybrid remote $74,358 - $111,536 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $74,358 - $111,536 a year Job Type Full-time Overview: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center is an independent, nonprofit organization providing adult cancer treatment and groundbreaking research focused on cancer and infectious diseases. Based in Seattle, Fred Hutch is the only National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center in Washington. With a track record of global leadership in bone marrow transplantation, HIV/AIDS prevention, immunotherapy and COVID-19 vaccines, Fred Hutch has earned a reputation as one of the world’s leading cancer, infectious disease and biomedical research centers. Fred Hutch operates eight clinical care sites that provide medical oncology, infusion, radiation, proton therapy and related services, and network affiliations with hospitals in five states. Together, our fully integrated research and clinical care teams seek to discover new cures to the world’s deadliest diseases and make life beyond cancer a reality. At Fred Hutch we value collaboration, compassion, determination, excellence, innovation, integrity and respect. These values are grounded in and expressed through the principles of diversity, equity and inclusion. Our mission is directly tied to the humanity, dignity and inherent value of each employee, patient, community member and supporter. Our commitment to learning across our differences and similarities make us stronger. We seek employees who bring different and innovative ways of seeing the world and solving problems. Fred Hutch is in pursuit of becoming an anti-racist organization. We are committed to ensuring that all candidates hired share our commitment to diversity, anti-racism and inclusion. The Clinical Trial Business Analyst role is a key part of our central team providing support to Principal Investigators (PIs) and research study teams who are focused on mission-critical clinical trials programs. The role is responsible for performing business analysis, data analysis, workflow design and supports a wide range of functions, including clinical trial start-up and trial operations. This is a high-growth opportunity and provides exposure to innovative and complex clinical trials in an academic setting. Fully remote or hybrid work options available. Responsibilities: Assist in workflow design and implementation for targeted process improvements related to clinical trials Deeply understand workflows that generate operational data and help identify workflow improvements based on trends noted in the data Work closely with the teams responsible for data and reporting functions to understand data sources and work to ensure efficient and accurate use of data; identify and close gaps as needed Gather requirements and document business rules for transforming data from source fields to target fields as needed; Support the translation of business requirements into specific dashboard requirements Maintain thorough documentation of business requirements and data definitions Assist in the development of data collection procedures to support dashboard development Create dynamic dashboards and visual tools to represent operational data Ensure report and data presentation quality by performing quality control reviews, and investigating and resolving data discrepancies Qualifications: Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in math, science, business, or related field Minimum 1 year of experience with clinical research, or other business operations or data analysis Highly reliable and detail oriented Excellent communication (written and oral), customer service, collaboration, problem solving and interpersonal skills Ability to work with ambiguity, and move forward effectively in a fast-paced project environment Preferred Requirements: Knowledge of clinical trials management systems Knowledge of EHR systems Hands-on experience using data visualization tools (E.g., Tableau) Hands-on experience using workflow management tools such as Zendesk, Smartsheet is desirable Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine requirement, with exceptions only for approved medical or religious accommodations. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees must, prior to their first day of employment: Provide proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 ; OR Initiate the accommodations process to request a religious or medical accommodation (medical accommodations require a healthcare provider’s certification). A statement describing your commitment and contributions toward greater diversity, equity, inclusion, and antiracism in your career or that will be made through your work at Fred Hutch is requested of all finalists. The annual base salary range for this position is from $74,358 to $111,536 and pay offered will be based on experience and qualifications. Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center offers employees a comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance health, well-being, and financial security. Benefits include medical/vision, dental, flexible spending accounts, life, disability, retirement, family life support, employee assistance program, onsite health clinic, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation (12-22 days per year), paid sick leave (12-25 days per year), paid holidays (13 days per year), paid parental leave (up to 4 weeks), and partially paid sabbatical leave (up to 6 months). Our Commitment to Diversity: We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) Employer. We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability (physical or mental), marital or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, political ideology, or membership in any other legally protected class. We are an Affirmative Action employer. We encourage individuals with diverse backgrounds to apply and desire priority referrals of protected veterans. If due to a disability you need assistance/and or a reasonable accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to our Employee Services Center at hrops@fredhutch.org or by calling 206-667-4700.

Sales Analyst - job post Weyerhaeuser 952 reviews Seattle, WA $58,110 - $87,101 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $58,110 - $87,101 a year Job Type Full-time Description The Wood Products Sales and Marketing organization is seeking a motivated, service oriented individual to join our team. This valued role contributes to our team’s success by collaborating daily across our Sales teams. Our ideal candidate is self-driven, motivated, dependable, and innovative, in looking for opportunities to excel within our organization. Weyerhaeuser prides itself on employee development. In fact, it’s one of our core values, along with a focus on excellence, a devotion to sustainability, the development of products that improve lives, and a commitment to tangible values. We are honored to have been named one of the World’s Top Ethical Companies® for 10 years, among other accolades. We also invest in company culture and hold regular events to enhance teamwork and give back to communities, both large and small, of which we form part of the fabric. The Sales Analyst role is an excellent opportunity to join Weyerhaeuser’s team. The location of this role is based in Hot Springs, AR. As a member of our Sales Analysis and Administration team, the Sales Analyst will use analytical skills and the ability to develop and manage reporting tools to help improve profitability across our 19 lumber, 6 OSB and 2 plywood mill system. The individual will be accountable for supporting our sales and tactical product management teams with sound analysis and reports to support decision making and business performance results. Accountabilities include: Managing pricing procedures, pricing analysis reports Producing daily sales reports and ad hoc requests Performing sales document analysis, identifying trends and providing insights Executing invoice corrections and claim management Key Functions: Provide analytical support for specific business initiatives needed to make marketing decisions, customer/product profitability improvement, and sales contract management Support commodity lumber, OSB and plywood sales for analytics and reporting. Assist teams with pricing data, order corrections, and other key sales and customer service functions Develop understanding of business data requirements, customers, and mill system. Learn to identify trends, and improvements for future to meet business and customer commitments Responsible for ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and access for decision-making Helps to maintain and improve training documents and SOP’s Qualifications GED/High School diploma Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI, Teams) Strong analytical aptitude Strong planning, decision making, organizational and time management skills Attention to detail Sound communication skills – verbal, written and presentation Preferred: Knowledge of wood product end-uses, market dynamics and product supply channels Understanding of process improvement concepts and efficient delivery Strong analytical skills Power BI/SQL and SAP experience or equivalent 4-year college degree What We Offer: Compensation : This role is eligible for our annual merit-increase program, and we are targeting a salary range of $58,110 to $87,101.00 based on your level of skills, qualifications and experience. You will also be eligible for our Annual Incentive Program, which offers a cash bonus targeting 5% of base pay. Potential plan funding may range from zero to two times that target. Benefits : When you join our team, you and your family will be covered by our comprehensive health benefits plan, which includes medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. We also support personal volunteerism, sponsor a host of diversity networks, promote mentoring, and provide training and development opportunities to help you chart your path to a fulfilling career. Retirement : Employees are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan, which includes a paid company match in addition to our annual contribution equal to 5% of your base salary. Paid Time Off or Vacation : We provide eligible employees who are scheduled to work 25 hours or more per week with paid vacation for up to 3 weeks to use during your first year of employment. In addition, after being employed for six months, eligible employees begin to accrue vacation for future use. We also recognize eleven paid holidays per year, providing a total of 88 hours along with paid parental leave for all full time employees. About Wood Products We've been delivering quality building products and solutions to our customers for more than 100 years. From builders and dealers to specifiers and homeowners, we offer exceptional product performance and unparalleled support. For more than a century, we’ve been building our reputation as a leader in sustainable wood products. About Weyerhaeuser We sustainably manage forests and manufacture products that make the world a better place. We’re serious about safety, driven to achieve excellence, and proud of what we do. With multiple business lines in locations across North America, we offer a range of exciting career opportunities for smart, talented people who are passionate about making a difference. We know you have a choice in your career. We want you to choose us. Weyerhaeuser is an equal opportunity employer. Inclusion is one of our five core values and we strive to maintain a culture where all our people feel a sense of belonging, opportunity and shared purpose. We are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce and supporting an equitable and inclusive environment that inspires people of all backgrounds to join, stay and thrive with our team. SD1 Job Customer Service, Design, Sales & Marketing Primary Location USA-WA-Seattle Other Locations USA-AR-Hot Springs Schedule Full-time Job Level Individual Contributor Job Type Experienced Shift Day (1st) Relocation Assistance Not Available

Business Systems Analyst - job post SanMar 464 reviews Issaquah, WA 98027 $80,000 - $110,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $80,000 - $110,000 a year Job Type Full-time At SanMar, the work you do makes a difference. What's the Short Version? The Business Systems Analyst supports select technical systems. The role determines areas for support and improvements, collects, analyzes, and evaluates business and users' needs across systems, and proposes technical solutions. They work closely with technical teams to define key processes, requirements, and system integrations. What Will You Be Doing? Work with business and technical stakeholders to develop and document functional and technical requirements for integration projects. Translate business rules and requirements into appropriate process workflows, charts, models, and technical specifications. Develop subject matter expertise in foundation data, application, and platform functionality and features. Conduct analysis of system issues and proposes technical solutions. Work closely with QA to ensure system is built and configured to requirements and design specification, participates in the development of the test plan and test cases. Identify opportunities for improved alerting and error handling including developing queries and configuring alerts. Maintain support documentation and assist with training business and technical support teams on new/revised functionality. Investigate issues that are escalated by Tier 1 and Tier 2 teams, engaging the right teams and providing guidance on corrective actions. Key partner in communications for project stakeholders and project managers, assisting with development of content and delivery of project communications and stakeholder management. Effectively communicate and document business and system information. May drive the project management of smaller projects and lead responsibility for analysis work streams within projects of significant size or impact. What Are We Looking For? Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or related field. 1-3 years experience as a systems analyst or related role Required. Experience with understanding and querying relational databases Required. Demonstrated ability to approach business problems from a disciplined, analytical perspective. Willing to take initiative to identify and anticipate improvement opportunities and make recommendations for implementation. Must be able to manage multiple assignments simultaneously and have strong organizational and prioritization skills. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional listening skills. Attention to detail and accuracy. Self-directed and motivated. A curious mind, strong critical thinking skills, and a continuous drive to expand and learn for the future. A bias for action with the ability to adapt quickly with a positive attitude toward change. Effective time management skills and ability to meet deadlines. Commitment to customer service. What's Our Offer? Salary Range: You`ll earn between $80,000 - $110,000 annually, depending on experience. Bonus: You`ll be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus up to 10% of base salary. Paid Time Off: You`ll accrue paid time off on a bi-weekly basis based on hours worked up to 112 hours per year to start. Employees also receive 7 paid holidays and 1 paid family day off. Additional Benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits 401k plan and matches $1 for $1 up to 4% of earnings, matched & vested at every pay cycle Life insurance Short/long-term disability coverage Paid maternity/paternity leave Pet insurance What Should You Expect? While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle or feel; frequently lift and/or move up to 30 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Work environment is moderately quiet. Employee must be able to handle strenuous customer deadlines and be flexible and available to interact with employees at all levels. Who is SanMar? SanMar is more than just a t-shirt company. We see t-shirts as a blank canvas that can be used to unite a team, tell a story or show your love for your favorite local haunt. We create meaningful connections that elevate lives through the apparel we provide. As the industry leader in promotional apparel, we live by a refreshingly simple philosophy: Be Nice and Tell the Truth. This is how we’ve done business since Marty Lott founded the company in 1971. Today we work with awesome apparel manufacturers from around the world, we’ve grown to more than 5,000 employees and we still work with those same simple principles in mind. You can see our values take shape in A Canvas for Good, our platform for positive action and citizenship. We are dedicated to being good stewards of the world we share, to lifting up the communities where we work and to respecting our employees. Our IDEA Council guides company-wide diversity efforts, and our annual Sustainability Report shows our progress toward our goals of doing business responsibly. Why Work at SanMar? Our people are at the heart of everything we do. They bring their talent, passion and dedication to work with them every day. Their hard work inspires us and gives us purpose. We love working here together. Whether you work in our headquarters, from your home or in one of our distribution centers across North America, we believe that investing in you is just the right thing to do. Our comprehensive benefits package is designed to support your health and well-being, life balance, career growth and (eventually) retirement. SanMar works with brands you already know, like Nike, The North Face and Brooks Brothers, as well as providing industry-leading private label apparel and accessories. Our people come to work excited to do their part, providing clothing that helps people feel that they’re a part of something special. Here’s your chance to be a part of this story. If you’re ready to work in a place where your participation matters and your growth is a priority, we’re ready for you. SanMar is an Equal Opportunity Employer Whoever you are, wherever you’re from, whoever you love or follow in faith, whatever your disability or superpower status, whichever ethnicity or gender you identify with, you are welcome at SanMar. SanMar participates in E-Verify.

The Business Analyst will lead data reporting transformation efforts at Cascade. The Business Analyst will work with organization teams across Cascade so they must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Ability to see the big picture without losing sight of the details. Must have Data Warehousing, Dataverse and Power Apps integration when applying. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Work with IT team to design and implement new data warehouse using Dataverse to be used across Cascade. Work with business users and analyze data requests to determine requirements. Lead requirements gathering process. Report development including the ability to design, implement and test reports using multiple reporting tools. Provide data for analysis by operations staff, internal executive level and/or direct clients as needed. Ensures data for all reports is accurate. Lead and train end users on how to effectively create reports using various reporting tools. Ability to coordinate multiple activities simultaneously. Ability to research, analyze and troubleshoot. Work within a team to support business users via the Help Desk and user requests. Other duties as assigned. JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree from four-year University or College or 5-10 years of relevant experience. 1+ years’ experience as a report data analyst with Microsoft BI technologies is required. Experience using Microsoft's stack, SharePoint and Teams is required. Knowledge of Data Warehousing, Dataverse and Power Apps integration. Ability to write SQL Queries against SQL Server is required. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong knowledge of relational database concepts and design. Excellent written and oral communication skills and comfortable interacting with various levels in the organization. Limited travel may be required. Salary range of $90k - $110k Cascade Environmental, LLC, and our subsidiaries is an Equal Opportunity employer. Fund Operations Analyst - job post Russell Investments 74 reviews Seattle, WA 98101 $60,000 - $65,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $60,000 - $65,000 a year Job Type Full-time Business Unit: Global Operations Job Description: As a member of the Alternative Investment Operations team you will support the administration of private equity, private real estate, hedge funds, and other fund complexes when needed. Your specific duties would include performance measurement and reporting, processing capital calls and distributions, cash management, preparation of quarterly reports, valuation support, audit and tax support, data entry, systems support, preparation of regulatory and internal fund reports, and updating policies and procedures. Salary Range: $60,000 - $65,000 Specific compensation will be based on candidate’s experience, skills, qualifications, commercial considerations, and other job-related factors permitted by law. At Russell Investments, salary is just one part of our compensation package. Our total rewards approach includes an annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility criteria) in addition to participation in our competitive benefits programs including healthcare, retirement, vacation, and wellbeing programs. Your Core Responsibilities: Capital Calls and Distributions - Assist with the preparation, tracking and completion of fund investment transactions, including detailed documentation and obtaining all required approvals. Valuation Support - Retrieving and tracking portfolio company valuations and inputting into industry-specific applications. Preparation of portfolio valuations and quarterly reports for internal and external clients. Subscription and Redemption documentation – Prepare and submit private equity and/or hedge fund documentation to underlying managers for trading implementation. Audit and Tax Support - Obtain and track K-1's and foreign reporting information from underlying funds. Prepare data for responding to client requests and audit confirmations. Assist with preparing notes to the financial statements. Interact with Tax and Financial Reporting teams. Cash Management - Preparation of wire instructions, cash projections and reconciliations. Reconcile and track unfunded commitments. Reporting - Input and maintain company and fund data. Prepare, coordinate, and distribute various internal and external reports on an ongoing and ad hoc basis. Prepare, review, and manage certain regulatory filings. Client Service - Act as a point of contact/liaison with investors, portfolio managers, administrators, and custodians for Fund Administration as it relates to the day-to-day operations for the funds. Address all inquiries with professionalism and timely response. Your Expertise: Bachelor's degree required. Understanding of the investment strategies of alternative investment funds, specifically Private Equity, Private Real Estate, and Hedge Funds, while also understanding industry standards in the marketplace and how they compare to Russell Investments’ products. Efficiency with Microsoft Office products and overall aptitude for utilizing technology to assist with business processing. Working knowledge of the relationships and interactions between money managers and administrators/custodians/transfer agents. Ability to perform technical analysis. Extensive knowledge of investment products and securities. Working knowledge of GAAP. Ability to interpret accounting/financial information and understand how, when implemented, it may affect corporate profitability, distributor attraction/attention and investor attraction/attention. Excellent client service skills; superior written and verbal communication abilities. Proven ability to work both independently and as part of a highly functioning team. Ability to work efficiently under pressure with minimal supervision; ability to organize and prioritize multiple assignments and meet deadlines. Equal Employment Opportunity Russell Investments is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all associates and employment applicants regardless of race, religion, ancestry, creed, color, gender (including gender identity which refers to a person's actual or perceived sex, and includes self-image, appearance, behavior or expression, whether or not different from that traditionally associated with a person's biological sex), age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, past or present unemployment status , or any other characteristic protected by law.

Sales Analyst - job post Moss Adams 164 reviews Seattle, WA Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time At Moss Adams, we champion authenticity. For us, that means fostering a culture of talented people who care—about you, about our clients, and about our communities. Here, you’ll work towards our mission of empowering others to embrace opportunity, growing as a leader along the way. Our firm’s size, middle-market clients, customized career paths, and supportive culture make this a reality. Join a values-driven firm where you’ll have fun while solving complex and interesting business challenges. The Sales Analyst supports the firm’s sales efforts by gathering intelligence and preparing materials about target industries, markets, companies, and people using external business intelligence sources, and the firm’s resources such as CRM, data warehouse, and other internal tools. The Sales Analyst helps the firm better understand market opportunities, including targeting and lead generation efforts, providing actionable insights to guide growth efforts. This position is also looked to for sales and revenue reporting, as well as varied sales operations duties. Individuals who thrive at Moss Adams exhibit the following success skills – Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Executive Presence, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus. Responsibilities: Conduct research on target industries, markets, companies, people, and competitors to support sales and growth efforts Compile, synthesize, and analyze large amounts of data from multiple databases to produce business insights that guide strategy and tactics for growth Collaborate with the Sales Director, various practice leaders, and other business development personnel to generate target lists and detailed market opportunity and prospect profiles Produce routine firm growth reporting, sales dashboards, trend analyses, and pipeline assessments using CRM and Power BI Support sales budget management, reconciling monthly financial reporting Support end users with training on the firm’s reporting and data tools, including CRM, Power BI, and others Contribute to CRM data quality and augmentation efforts Serve as a power user of marketing and sales research applications, including ZoomInfo, Demandbase, PitchBook, IBIS World, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator, among others Support, as needed, the firm’s commission automation software upkeep and reporting Perform other sales operations support duties as required Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required; emphasis in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related field preferred Minimum of 1 year of experience required; experience in a professional services environment preferred Advanced Excel skills and experience analyzing complex data strongly preferred Experience performing market research with online tools (e.g., ZoomInfo, Pitchbook) Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex issues to others Strong organizational skills; able to effectively prioritize assignments and competing deadlines in a fast-paced environment Ability to collaborate and work effectively across functions/departments/teams while building trusted relationships and positively influencing others Knowledge of CRM systems (preferably Microsoft Dynamics) and Power BI preferred Knowledge of, or experience with, financial modeling preferred Ability to travel as needed, approximately 5% Moss Adams is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Portfolio Analyst, West - job post THE ENERGY AUTHORITY 9 reviews Bellevue, WA 98004 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time About The Energy Authority The Energy Authority is a public power-owned, nonprofit corporation with offices in Jacksonville, Florida and Bellevue (Seattle), Washington. TEA provides public power utilities with access to advanced resources and technology systems so they can respond competitively in the changing energy markets. Through partnership with TEA, utilities benefit from an experienced organization that is singularly focused on deriving the maximum value of their assets from the market. TEA Values TEA employees share a common sense of purpose, focused on maximizing the value of each client’s generation assets. We understand that when TEA accomplishes its mission the result is enhanced economic value and improved quality of life for the citizens and businesses of the communities our clients serve. TEA employees exceed the expectations of those they serve, deliver services with the highest standards of fair, honest and ethical behavior, set the standard for service and expertise in our industry, embody a spirit of collaboration, and embrace TEA’s founding entrepreneurial spirit by seizing opportunities to deliver value. Do what you love. Love what you do. About This Role The electric power industry is facing significant challenges as new threats face the industry in the form of new competitors for serving utility customers directly (i.e. aggregation services); new technology that allows a third party to insert itself between the utility and its customers (i.e. NEST, Internet of Things, smart meters, etc.); lower cost and improved technology that is accessible to the customer directly (i.e. improved cost and operation of rooftop solar, micro-grids); expanding markets (expansion of organized markets into new areas such as CAISO expansion outside of California, consortium of western states looking at SPP, new market in the southeast); new market products (i.e. capacity markets, expansion of demand reduction); opportunity for new utility grade supply resources (Clean Coal, Carbon Black, etc.); and changing state and Federal regulations impacting the utility industry, to name just a few. The challenge for The Energy Authority’s (TEA) Portfolio Analysts will be to perform the necessary modeling to capture the risks and opportunities for TEA’s Members and Partners through participation in the energy and congestion rights markets. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Utilize Stochastic and Financial Risk models to enable our customers to make smart hedging decisions Trading analysis and asset valuation to facilitate profitable trading Economic advice to our customers and senior management regarding portfolios and strategic decision making Forecasting of key market drivers The desired analytical skills within TEA’s Analytics Department include: Basic Skills– TEA expects all analysts to have or develop all the following skills: Strong working knowledge of MS Office productivity and automation software, especially Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Strong oral and written communications skills Strong knowledge of finance and business analysis Strong knowledge of energy industry fundamentals Strong knowledge of bilateral, exchanged traded, and RTO energy markets Ability to operate and maintain financial models operate and maintain models to support routine analysis develop and maintain strong working knowledge of tools used by TEA Advanced Skills – TEA expects that analysts will have or work to acquire some or all the following skills as they advance through the organization: Strong working knowledge of database query and programming capability Understanding of statistics and probability Ability to build fundamental-based models for asset and trade valuation Ability to design financial models and evaluate their effectiveness Develop and maintain strong working knowledge of the theory and practice of complex analytical models Design, build and evaluate basic models Maintain and upgrade complex models – evaluate their performance Acquire strong knowledge of functions performed by various areas of TEA All Portfolio Analysts Monitor FERC, EPA, and relevant State regulatory agencies to understand their existing and proposed rules and tariffs Develop in-depth knowledge of the relevant analytical tools utilized within TEA’s Analytics department and be prepared to use these tools and applications on an as needed basis. These tools and applications may include some or all the following: Production Cost Modeling software HedgeFox EPIS’ AuroraXMP Energy Exemplar’s PLEXOS Business Intelligence applications R-Shiny applications Tableau Energy specific online applications YES Energy Genscape ABB’s Velocity Suite Object-Oriented programming and structured query languages VBA R Python MATLAB SQL Assist TEA’s staff, and the staff of TEA’s Members and Partners, in the review and analyses of potential industry changes that could impact our Members and Partners The ability and willingness to travel for team meetings, project meetings, and conferences on an as needed basis EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelor of Science in finance, economics, accounting, or other appropriate degree; Bachelor of Science degree in engineering, any discipline; sciences such as (but not limited to) advanced mathematics, physics, and chemistry; computer sciences; Relevant industry experience; Master’s Degree is preferred. COMPENSATION Our base salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Our entry level range is $73,699 - $99,711, our mid level range is $86,705 - $117,307, and our senior level range is $113,338 - $153,340. This position also comes with an annual target short-term incentive rate of 17.5% of base salary based on corporate, team, and individual performance. Consultant - Seattle - Campus Recruiting 2023 - job post Capgemini 9,181 reviews Seattle, WA Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Consultant - Seattle - Campus Recruiting 2023 070247 CAPGEMINI STAFF CONSULTANT ROLE Who are we? We are global. With more than 200,000 people, Capgemini is present in over 40 countries. We are results oriented. A global leader in consulting, technology and professional services, The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion. We are committed to delivery. Together with its clients, Capgemini creates and delivers business and technology solutions that fit their needs and drive the results they want. Capgemini has developed its own way of working, the Collaborative Business Experience™, and draws on Rightshore®, its worldwide delivery model. We invest in our people. Capgemini helps each new consultant hit the ground running with a robust training program. Throughout your career, we offer structured programs and on-the-job training to provide you with the technology and professional skills to help you be a successful consultant and support your professional development. We live our core values. Capgemini provides a collaborative environment that embodies and holds the following stated values close to heart: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, and Fun. What can you expect in a career with Capgemini? Growth: Throughout your experience at Capgemini you will have multiple opportunities for growth both personally and professionally. During your first year, you will be a part of the Capgemini365 program. This first year experience program is designed for you to have mentorship and guidance while you are kick-starting your career at Capgemini. Within North America we have a Learning & Developmnet Team, multiple Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and Talent Development Team that will help assist you throughout your career. Collaboration: Capgemini prides itselt on be a collaborative organization. Majority of our projects are team-centric. You will work alongside technical, functional and industry specialists to assist with the development, implementation, integration and management of innovative solutions using a variety of methods, techniques and tools. Exposure: Capgemini has a footprint in a variety of industries including Telecommunications, Media and Television, Consumer Products, Retail and Distribution, Energy, Utilities and Chemicals, Manufacturing, Automotive, Life-sciences and Services. As a consultant you will have the opportunity to gain exposure across indsutries. Guidance: Your network at Capgemini begins the day you apply to the organization. You will be introduced to a variety of key stakeholders throughout your onboarding experience. These individuals will guide you throughout your career. Community: While Capgemini is a global company, we create communities whether that is virtual, in the office or at a client site. When you join, you are introduced to your first Capgemini community through the two week onboarding program. Who are we looking for? The ideal Capgemini consultant possesses the following qualities: Interest in working with technology to design, quality check and manage various solutions and advancements for our clients Excellent communication skills Eager and desire to learn new things in a rapid-fast paced environment Analytical and prolem solver Desire to work in a culturally diverse, team-based environment Overall resilient, flexible, and enthusiastic personality What will be my first role? Our informal motto is “it depends”. In client serving roles, we are rapidly evolving to cater to the current market. Sometimes we may ask you to be flexible in taking on a new role. Below is a brief description of the role(s) you may fill: Business Analyst: Business Analysts enable the transformation and performance improvement of an enterprise or its parts, with respect to people, process and technology, by providing relevant capabilities, assets (human and non-human), processes and tools. Business Analysts structure, analyze and visualize an enterprise’s current state. They design and visualize the future state. They also design and guide the change process from current to future state. Developing industry knowledge is extremely important for all Business Analysts. Functional analysts can specialize in Business fundamentals, Enterprise Resource Process software, Application Management or Custom Software Development. Programmer / Developer: Programmers and developers are responsible for programming and developing software using various programming languages and related tools and frameworks, reviewing code, programming per the requirement, fixing bugs and quality assurance. In gaining experience as a programmer, they become responsible for interpreting architecture and design, code reviews, monitoring, guiding and monitoring programmers, ensuring adherence to programming and documenting policies, software development, testing and release. Project Management Office (PMO) Analyst: PMO Analysts are a group with a business that defines and maintains standards for project management within the organization or project. They are responsible for initiating, planning, executing and closing projects. It is aimed at ensuring standardization, reducing duplication and leveraging resources such as people technology and communication. Quality Engineer: Testing Analysts are responsible for identifying and defining the required tests, monitoring the test coverage, and evaluating the overall quality of the software. This role is responsible for the reliability, quality, and performance of the software through software quality assurance. This includes opportunities through manual, automated, and performance testing. Capgemini discloses salary range information in compliance with state and local pay transparency obligations. This position is located in the city of South Park, Seattle. The role of the IT Project Coordinator is to support the successful completion of IT projects and activities. This includes defining and documenting all policies and processes of project lifecycles in order to deliver projects according to plan and within budget. The IT Project Coordinator initiates methodologies for defining project key performance metrics, allocating resources and prioritizing to the greatest extent possible. The coordinator accepts requests for IT project work based on organizational priorities and input from project sponsors, leaders, stakeholders and IT. The IT Project Coordinator also provides ongoing updates and information to IT management. Duties and Responsibilities: Communicates best practices, techniques, and tools for project planning, execution, project management, ongoing milestone/deliverable tracking, communication, and key performance metrics. Provides guidance about project management standards and techniques to appropriate staff. Monitors project budget proposals, and recommend changes where necessary. Establish project timelines and milestones/deliverables using the appropriate tools. Effectively manage project plans and schedules, and ensure deliverables are completed. Track and monitor all project milestones and deliverables and determine frequency and content of status reports, analyze results, and troubleshoot problem areas/mitigate project risks. Accept and assess status reports, change requests, and requirements documentation to ensure smooth project progression. Assist with project post mortems and create lessons learned in order to identify successful and unsuccessful project elements for process improvement. Where required, negotiate with department managers for the acquisition of required personnel from within the organization. Support project team members, contractors and consultants. Identify and resolve issues and conflicts within and between project participants. Participate in and record proceedings and minutes of executive, clinical and project team meetings and sponsored sessions. Work with multiple departments to coordinate project tasks Other duties as assigned Required Qualifications: 1+ years demonstrated experience in IT project management 1+ years business analyst or equivalent experience Experience with electronic health records systems Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and follow through on projects to completion Experience in developing and deploying project best practices, policies, procedures, and processes. Ability to facilitate relations between business groups and technology. Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Ability to adjust to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Vendor management experience Experience in MS Project or equivalent project management tools.
